page.title: 05GRASSLAND IN BERKELEY VALE
page.content: The{grassland}around Berkeley Power Station is mainly used for{grazing cattle. When the weather is warm enough cattle go out into the fields; they are brought in early morning and late afternoon for{milking.}During the summer they do not need the feed concentrates as the grass should give them all they need. During the summer though, nitrogen{fertilisers}are used to help grass growth to ensure enough summer and winter feed. {Silage}is the most popular way of storing crops with local farmers. It can either be in sealed, clamped containers with the grass well compacted to remove air or in rolls in sealed air tight bags. Both methods are used locally. {Hay}is often made, weather permitting the drying, and stored in large barns. Some of the bales can weigh \ tonne.
